YOUR AMERICAN FLAGSHIP
AMERICAN AIRLINES
AMERICA'S LEADING AIRLINE

Important Reminders
Proof of citizenship is required - such as: birth or baptismal
certificate, poll-tax receipt, voter's registration, U. S. Army
or Navy discharge papers, passport, any government paper
that states your birth in the U. S., or an affidavit signed
before a notary public.
Military personnel - who bring their ID cards to prove active
service do not have to purchase the $3 tourist card for
themselves or their families.
Federal employees - may also save the $3 tourist card fee by
bringing proof of their employment.
Canadians - must bring their passports.
If you fail to bring or misplace the required car ownership or
citizenship papers, the Humble Touring Service in Laredo
or Brownsville will issue proper affidavits free-of-charge.
Refer to Humble "TOURISTIPS FOR MEXICO" booklet for
more detailed information concerning entry regulations and
travel suggestions.
Printed in U.S.A.

FOR YOUR CONVENIENCE.
The Humble Border Touring Service offers visitors to
Mexico these special free services:
• Preliminary papers and affidavits for your tourist
cards and auto permits, to save you time at the
border immigration station.
• Money exchange.
• At reasonable rates, automobile insurance for covet-
age in Mexico.
• Current highway information and ideas for alternate
routes.
• Customs and immigration regulations.
• Mexico travel folders.
• Assistance in making hotel reservations.

DEAR PASSENGER:
American Airlines has often been described as the leader in air transportation.
hope we merit that distinction and will continue to merit it. To do that we
must continue to please you, the customer. Never entirely satistied with our
service, each day we endeavor to make it better.
If you have suggestions to improve the service, please give us the benefit of
them. If your journey has been pleasant, tell us about it; it will encourage us
If any individual rendered outstanding service, give me the name and we
commend him or her for vou.
We are glad
you will travel often with
American.
Sincerely.
